title: Transfer
description: Defines the movement of an Asset (eg cash, securities or commodities) between two parties on a date.

quantity.description: Represents the amount of the asset to be transferred. The cashflow amount is always a positive number, as the cashflow direction is implied by the payer/receiver attribute.

asset.description: Represents the object that is subject to the transfer, it could be an asset or a reference.

settlementDate.description: Represents the date on which the transfer to due.

identifier.description: Represents a unique reference to the transfer.

payerReceiver.description: Represents the parties to the transfer and their role.

settlementOrigin.description: Represents the origin to the transfer as a reference for lineage purposes, whether it originated from trade level settlement terms or from payment terms on an economic payout.

resetOrigin.description: Represents the reset and observation values that were used to determine the transfer amount.

transferExpression.description: Specifies a transfer expression (cash price, performance amount, scheduled payment amount, etc.) to define the nature of the transfer amount and its source.
